chapter.title: Object tree, Stream, Selection and Property editor
chapter.para: The right part of PdfEditor is called Object tree and Property editor.

Pdf file consists of objects which form a tree-like structure. There are several simple objects (null, boolean, integer, real, string, name, reference) and few complex (array, dictionary, stream). Object tree displays the tree-like object hierarchy starting at the most important objects and Property editor displays the contents of selected object in human readable form and allows editing the objects in raw form.

Object tree is not the only tool which shows pdf objects. Specialized tools are used to show some special objects more clearly. The content stream is shown in Stream window and selected operators from a content stream are shown in Selection window.
Object tree, Stream, Selection and Property editor

sect1.title: Purpose and usage
sect1.para: The purpose of the these windows is enabling complete control over pdf objects and structure of a pdf file. It allows editing raw objects which mostly requires knowledge of the pdf standard. It also shows raw structure of a pdf file.

We gain complete control over pdf file with this tool. It can be used for advanced editing that almost makes PdfEditor a pdf creator. With the description of operators, object type highlighting and object importance visualization this tool can be also used by normal users for simple but powerful editions. We can add and delete objects almost at will (some top level objects are just for more human readibility and can be neither deleted nor added.)

sect1.title: Controls
sect1.para: There are two ways how to to open, close and select objects. We can use either mouse or arrows. Up/down is used to go one object above/below current and right/left is used to open/close complext objects.
